attachments.text:
Issue 1: Equalify Properties are duplicating with user error. To reproduce:

1. Upload a faulty sitemap, with syntax errors in it.
2. Choose "Settings" from the top menu.
3. Choose the Property.
4. Enter a faulty sitemap in 'sitemap url' field.
5. Click "Send to scan".
6. Equalify will respond with "2024-04-22 13:55:26: Property results are not formatted correctly" in light grey next to the "Send to Scan" button.
7. Choose "Reports" from the top menu.
8. Choose "Settings" from the top menu.
9. You will see a new duplicate "Property" for _every_ failed scan.

Link to see image of duplicate Properties: <https://duke.box.com/s/f3fil37nrldk9nirrijp312avjqiusv4|https://duke.box.com/s/f3fil37nrldk9nirrijp312avjqiusv4>

Expected behavior:  
Not generating a new Property for each failed attempt to Scan new potentially faulty sitemap.

Sidenote: My old sitemap.xml was accepted and scanned fine last month. See old version here:  
<https://github.com/joelhsmith/debug-examples/commit/5b4b94a7e8d4c10a054f41bc4405e83e010e0e62|joelhsmith/debug-examples@5b4b94a>

Not it does not work. Maybe there is new validation going on since last month?

I have uploaded a new valid sitemap:  
<https://joelhsmith.github.io/debug-examples/lh-tests/sitemap.xml|https://joelhsmith.github.io/debug-examples/lh-tests/sitemap.xml>

I get the same error as the previous sitemap.

Issue 2: Sitemap is cached, maybe?  
The new sitemap above is valid and I get the same error as I had with my invalid sitemap.
attachments.title: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify-frontend/issues/4|#4 Multiple duplicate Properties generated when user has invalid sitemap>

attachments.text:
This PR introduces several updates and new components aimed at improving the user experience and preparing for the integration of live data:

*Added*

• `Timeline` component for visualizing report data.
• `Skeleton` component to indicate loading states.
• `DataTable` component for displaying report details.
• Hooks (`useReportDetails`, `useReports`) for fetching mock data.
• `Reports` and `ReportDetails` pages with loading states and placeholders.
• New routes for report creation and detail views.

*Updated*

• 404 page layout and redirect functionality.
• Footer to reflect the new version number (0.3.0).
• Header component for improved navigation.
• Global CSS for better autofill styles and utility functions.
• Layout enhancements focusing on authentication flows.

*Dependencies*

• Integrated `@tanstack/react-table` and `recharts` libraries for data handling and visualization.

*Next Steps*

• Replace placeholders with API-driven content.
• Expand user interactions with live data integration.

`<https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify-frontend/commit/b87ee93f8f2df8ed7553a718ebb0bdf55f1a84ac|b87ee93f>` - Export Reports and ReportDetails routes

`<https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify-frontend/commit/96950af12ac4e184e838466aaccf46697dd637f6|96950af1>` - Add @tanstack/react-table and recharts dependencies
`<https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify-frontend/commit/08b905d8f522bced9eebe775fa84a40d8a529c33|08b905d8>` - Merge pull request #5 from wilsuriel03/feature/reports-ui

This PR introduces several updates and new components aimed at improving the user experience and preparing for the integration of live data:

*Added*

• `Timeline` component for visualizing report data.
• `Skeleton` component to indicate loading states.
• `DataTable` component for displaying report details.
• Hooks (`useReportDetails`, `useReports`) for fetching mock data.
• `Reports` and `ReportDetails` pages with loading states and placeholders.
• New routes for report creation and detail views.

*Updated*

• 404 page layout and redirect functionality.
• Footer to reflect the new version number (0.3.0).
• Header component for improved navigation.
• Global CSS for better autofill styles and utility functions.
• Layout enhancements focusing on authentication flows.

*Dependencies*

• Integrated `@tanstack/react-table` and `recharts` libraries for data handling and visualization.

*Next Steps*

• Replace placeholders with API-driven content.
• Expand user interactions with live data integration.
